items.title: Manchester United emphatically clear up confusion over Amorim‚Äôs job title | Football Daily
items.summary: Sign up now! Sign up now! Sign up now? Sign up now! Considering it took Chelsea 19 days to sack Enzo Maresca following his very public act of insubordination towards the Stamford Bridge hierarchy in mid-December, it is only the speed with which Manchester United kicked their head coach towards the kerb following yesterday‚Äôs outburst at Elland Road that might have come as a surprise to Ruben Amorim. Short of rocking up for his post-match press conference waving a placard bearing the slogan ‚ÄúPlease Sack Me‚Äù, the Portuguese could scarcely have done more to ensure the abrupt receipt of his marching orders. As if his repeated insistence he was ‚Äúgoing to be manager of this team, not head coach‚Äù wasn‚Äôt enough, Amorim threw shade at Jason Wilcox, the club sporting director, and announced there‚Äôd be a Ruben-shaped hole in the Old Trafford exit door when his contract expired in 18 months ‚Äì unless he was sacked first. Less than 18 hours later, with the monotonous predictability of a Bazballing batter throwing away his wicket to a time-killing pre-lunch long hop, any remaining confusion over the 40-year-old‚Äôs exact job title was finally cleared up ‚Äì Amorim is now neither manager nor head coach at United, but gainfully and perhaps mercifully unemployed. What next for the bin fire that is present-day Manchester United? Will they bring back Ole Gunnar Solskj√¶r, hire Carlo Ancelotti‚Äôs eyebrow, or ask Martin O‚ÄôNeill to steady the ship but just for eight games? Perhaps they‚Äôll blow the cobwebs off Sir Alex Ferguson and get him to see out the campaign (except he might actually win a trophy and then insist on staying in charge). Still, it could be worse ‚Äî they could give Big Ange his third Premier League club of the season. After all, what could possibly go wrong? ‚Äì Mark McFadden. My family and I have been attending every England match for the last three years to get enough caps to secure tickets for Englands World Cup campaign in USA USA USA. Despite the paltry ticket allocation and ridiculous prices we applied for tickets. Over the weekend we cancelled our applications. Peace prize anyone?‚Äù ‚Äì Ben Gibbes. La Liga side Osasuna have just launched an ‚ÄòOsasunista desde la cuna‚Äô (Osasunista from the Cradle) initiative, in which all babies born in Navarra receive a free shirt, shorts, toy and notebook, plus ‚Ç¨50 deposited in an account. I would suggest Premier League clubs do the same, but we all know how that would pan out‚Äù ‚Äì Noble Francis. So, you urged the reader to ‚Äòpour yourself a pint of wine‚Äô (Football Daily Christmas awards). I received that at 12.04pm on 17 December, possibly a new record. Given the time of year, would it be 100 miles wide of the mark for me to suggest that pints of wine contributed to the timing, as well as the content of this piece?‚Äù ‚Äì Glynn Marshall. As a patron of your august publication. I totally delighted in your working conditions sign-off in the Christmas awards. Fabulous. Well deserved. Thanks for your efforts‚Äù ‚Äì S Sullivan (Sully). Please stop‚Äù ‚Äì Frankie Dodds. This is an extract from our daily football email ‚Ä¶ Football Daily. To get the full version, just visit this page and follow the instructions. Continue reading...

items.title: Brys haalt uit naar Eto'o: 'Iemand wilde tonen dat hij de sterkste is'
items.summary: Kameroen plaatste zich zondag voor de kwartfinales van de Afrika Cup, maar bondscoach Marc Brys ontbreekt opvallend genoeg op het toernooi. De Belg mocht niet afreizen naar Marokko en spaart daarbij bondsvoorzitter Samuel Eto'o niet. Volgens Brys is hij bewust buitenspel gezet in een machtsstrijd.

items.title: NAC-aanvoerder Kemper bedankt voor Grieks avontuur
items.summary: Boy Kemper (26) blijft, in ieder geval voor nu, aan NAC Breda verbonden. De aanvoerder van de Eredivisie-hekkensluiter stond in de belangstelling van een club uit de Griekse Super League, maar heeft bedankt voor dit buitenlandse avontuur.

items.title: Ruben Amorim sacked: timeline of his Manchester United tenure ‚Äì video
items.summary: Ruben Amorim has been sacked by Manchester United after 14 months as their head coach. He leaves Old Trafford after a power struggle with the hierarchy over transfer policy, with Amorim demanding his colleagues in the recruitment department 'do their job' after Sunday‚Äôs draw at Leeds. We take a look back at his turbulent reign, which featured a few fleeting highs but some miserable lows. Amorim sacked by Manchester United and Fletcher takes interim role ‚Äì live Continue reading...

items.title: Tactics, transfers and turmoil - inside the fall of Amorim

items.title: Ruben Amorim is gone, but Manchester United‚Äôs forever crisis rolls on | Jonathan Wilson
items.summary: The head coach (or should that be manager?) fired cryptic shots at his Old Trafford bosses, then was fired himself Amorim sacked after power struggle over transfers Discontent at Manchester United these days is only ever deferred. Ruben Amorim‚Äôs departure from the club on Monday was long anticipated and came, in the end, with a weary sigh. He had made a half-hearted protest about the recruitment structure after Sunday‚Äôs draw at Leeds, but it felt even at the time like barely more than a gesture. And so another manager, the seventh since Sir Alex Ferguson left in 2013, falls victim to the United meat-grinder. Everybody at United, fundamentally, is unhappy. And not unhappy in the sense that Alex Ferguson used to be unhappy, when the club was essentially fuelled by his volcanic rages, but enervated, frustrated by the realisation that this is not how things used to be, that this was once the biggest football club in the country and now they keep failing to get the win they need to lift them to fifth. Continue reading...

items.title: Celtic sack manager Nancy after eight games
items.summary: Celtic sack manager Wilfried Nancy after just 33 days in charge - with head of football operations Paul Tisdale also dismissed.
